conclusion: Determine forces on each block and calculate maximum force F.

Two blocks, A and B, stacked on a surface. Block A is on top of block B. A horizontal force F is applied to block B. Mass of A is 1 kg, mass of B is 2 kg. Max static friction between A and B is 1 N, coefficient of kinetic friction between B and ground is 0.1.
Calculate weight of block A: 10 N; weight of block B: 20 N.
Max static friction force between A and B is 1 N, limiting force F to 1 N to prevent A from moving.
Calculate kinetic friction between B and ground: 2 N.
Force F must be less than sum of static and kinetic friction to keep blocks stationary: F < 3 N.
Condition for keeping blocks stationary is F does not exceed 3 N.
